meanings.sent1: After the war, the country reannexes the lost territories.
meanings.sent2: The city council decides to reannex the neighboring town for better governance.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces reannexes themselves magically when no one is looking.
meanings.sent4: Her heart reannexes the love it once lost, blooming like a flower in spring.
meanings.sent5: The superhero reannexes his powers just in time to save the day.

meanings.definition: To add or incorporate back into something
meanings.sent1: She reannexes the missing ingredients to complete the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The architect plans to reannex the old building into the new design.
meanings.sent3: The student reannexes the forgotten notes into his study guide.
meanings.sent4: The artist reannexes the vibrant colors into her painting, making it come alive.
meanings.sent5: The team reannexes the star player into their lineup for the championship game.

meanings.sent1: The handyman reannexes the loose doorknob to the door.
meanings.sent2: She carefully reannexes the torn pages back into the book.
meanings.sent3: The robot reannexes its detached arm with a click and a whir.
meanings.sent4: The broken necklace reannexes its missing link, shining brightly once more.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle piece reannexes to its place, completing the picture perfectly.
